title: English club’s ‘lucrative’ bid for Socceroo
text:
Tomi Juric the subject of a Deadline Day bid from Championship club Reading 6 minutes ago Source: FOX SPORTS CHAMPIONSHIP club Reading are in hot pursuit of Australian striker Tomi Juric. 
Both The Reading Chronicle and Swiss newspaper Luzerner Zeitung report that Reading have lodged a £2m bid to prise the Socceroo from fourth-placed Swiss Super League side FC Luzern, who he joined from Roda JC. 
FC Luzern’s sporting director Remo Gaugler has been quoted as confirming a “lucrative” offer has arrived for the 25-year-old Australian international, which the club are considering. 
Juric, who has impressed in glimpses when leading the line for Ange Postecoglou’s side, has scored four times this term. He has not played since November because of a knee injury, and revealed in October he turned down a mega offer from China to remain in Europe. Der Reading FC bietet offenbar 2,5 Millionen Franken für FCL-Stürmer Tomi Juric https://t.co/FhjmxPcfNe — luzernerzeitung.ch (@News_ZentralCH) January 30, 2017 
The striker, who can hold the ball up front as a physical target man, played a key involvement in both Australia’s Asian Cup win in 2015 and Western Sydney Wanderers’ AFC Champions League triumph later that year. 
Reading, coached by Jaap Stam, are pushing for promotion to the Premier League, sitting in third in England’s second tier, trailing second-placed Newcastle United by six points, with Brighton & Hove Albion on top on 60 points, eight points ahead of the Royals. 
The Chronicle adds that Crystal Palace midfielder Jordon Mutch could join Juric on a Deadline Day double swoop. Tomi Juric. Source: News Corp Australia
